api_contracts.description: Returns a simple greeting message with HTTP 200 status code

component_logic.responsibility: Initialize and configure the FastAPI HTTP server framework with routing infrastructure

interfaces.description: Create and return a configured FastAPI application instance
Register all route handlers with the FastAPI application

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI 0.104+ to create the application instance. Configure with title='Hello World API' and version='1.0.0'. Set up CORS if needed for cross-origin requests. Use uvicorn as the ASGI server for local development and production. Initialize app with default settings (no custom middleware required for this minimal implementation).

component_logic.responsibility: Handle GET /hello requests and return a greeting message with proper response serialization

interfaces.description: Process GET /hello request and return greeting message as JSON

component_logic.implementation_notes: Implement as a FastAPI route handler decorated with @app.get('/hello'). Return a dictionary with key 'message' and value 'Hello World'. FastAPI automatically serializes the dictionary to JSON with Content-Type: application/json. No request parameters or query strings required. Handler should be synchronous (no async needed for this simple operation). Response status code defaults to 200 OK.

component_logic.responsibility: Format HTTP responses with proper status codes and content-type headers for JSON serialization

interfaces.description: Format successful response data with proper structure
Format error response with status code and error details

component_logic.implementation_notes: For success responses, return the data dictionary as-is (FastAPI handles JSON serialization automatically with status_code=200). For error responses, use FastAPI's HTTPException with status_code parameter and detail containing error_code and message. Set Content-Type header to application/json (FastAPI default). Handle 500 Internal Server Error by catching unexpected exceptions in route handlers and returning formatted error response. All responses must include proper HTTP status codes (200 for success, 500 for errors).

design_review_checklist.description: Verify HTTP server framework is properly initialized and routing is configured
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HTTPServerFramework component must create FastAPI app instance. HelloRouteHandler must be registered as GET /hello route. App must start without errors on uvicorn.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify all error cases return proper HTTP status codes and error responses
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Unexpected exceptions must be caught and return 500 status code with error_code and message. Response must be valid JSON with proper Content-Type header.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response serialization is efficient and uses FastAPI's built-in JSON encoding
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler must return plain dictionary (not string). FastAPI must handle JSON serialization automatically. No manual json.dumps() calls needed.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response format matches API contract specification
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: GET /hello must return JSON object with 'message' key containing string 'Hello World'. Response status code must be 200. Content-Type must be application/json.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component dependencies are correctly structured with no circular dependencies
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler depends on HTTPServerFramework. ResponseFormatter has no dependencies. No circular dependency chains exist.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify no sensitive data is exposed in responses or error messages
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response contains only 'Hello World' message. Error responses must not expose stack traces or internal implementation details. All responses must be safe for public consumption.

architecture_overview: Minimal three-tier architecture for a simple greeting API. HTTPServerFramework initializes and configures the FastAPI application with routing infrastructure. HelloRouteHandler implements the GET /hello endpoint that returns a JSON response with a greeting message. ResponseFormatter ensures all HTTP responses (success and error) are properly formatted with correct status codes and Content-Type headers. The application uses FastAPI's built-in JSON serialization and automatic OpenAPI documentation generation. No database, authentication, or complex business logic required.

technology_stack.json_serialization: FastAPI built-in (uses pydantic v2 for serialization)

assumptions: FastAPI is installed and available in the Python environment
uvicorn ASGI server is used to run the application
No authentication or authorization is required for the /hello endpoint
No database or persistent storage is needed
The application runs on localhost:8000 by default (standard uvicorn configuration)
JSON response format is acceptable (no XML or other formats required)
No request body or query parameters are needed for the /hello endpoint
HTTP 200 OK is the only success status code needed
FastAPI's automatic OpenAPI/Swagger documentation generation is acceptable
